title: Install Patch over Base - Fresh Install - Successful Log In
custom_preconds:
- Base build is installed 
- User is not logged in to an NHL.TV Account in base build.
custom_steps:
1. Install current NHL.TV build
2. Launch installed build
3. At Welcome Screen Activate Log in button [X]
4. Log in to NHL.TV Account
custom_expected:
App launches successfully 
AND allows login 
AND is presented with the On-boarding Flow 
(Select Favorite/Follow Teams)

title: Install Patch over Base and Previous Patch - Not Logged In - On-boarding flow
custom_preconds:
- Base build is installed 
- Previous patch release is freshly installed over the base (check the latest build in retail) 
- User is not logged in to an NHL.TV Account
- User has not completed the initial On-boarding flow before
custom_steps:
1. Launch the previous patch release
2. At Welcome Screen, select the Log In Later button [O]
3. Verify "Step 1" of the On-boarding flow appears
4. Close the app (hold down PS logo button)
6. Install the newest NHL.TV build over the previous patch
7. Launch new installed build
8. At Welcome Screen, select the Log In Later button [O]
custom_expected:
App presents the On-boarding Flow again
(Select Favorite/Follow Teams and Hide Scores)

title: Install Patch over Base and Previous Patch - Not Logged In - NO On-boarding flow
custom_preconds:
- Base build is installed 
- Previous patch release is freshly installed over the base (check the latest build in retail) 
- User is not logged in to an NHL.TV Account
- User has completed the initial On-boarding flow before
custom_steps:
1. Launch the previous patch release
2. At Welcome Screen, select the Log In Later button [O]
3. Verify "Step 1" of the On-boarding flow appears
4. Set or skip a favorite team
5. On "Step 2" select the Done button
6. Close the app (hold down PS logo button)
7. Install the newest NHL.TV build over the previous patch
8. Launch new installed build
custom_expected:
App does NOT present the On-boarding Flow again
AND launches directly to the Scores page

title: Install Patch over Base and Previous Patch - Logged In
custom_preconds:
- Base build is installed 
- Previous patch release is freshly installed over the base (check the latest build in retail)
- User has logged into an NHL.TV Account in the previous patch release
- User has already seen and advanced through current Onboarding Screens in the patch release
custom_steps:
1. Close the app (hold down PS logo button)
2. Install the newest NHL.TV build over the previous patch
3. Launch new installed build
custom_expected:
App Launches to SCORES view and user is NOT presented with the On-boarding Flow 
(Select Favorite/Follow Teams and Hide Scores)
User remains logged in with previous credentials

title: Splash Screen - Loading Animation to Login screen.
custom_preconds:
- NHL.TV app is freshly installed 
- User has not logged in or launched app
custom_steps: From Playstation XMB or Home screen, launch app and observe
custom_expected:
- NHL.TV Splash Screen is seen
- Loading animation spins to signify loading (legacy app showed Puck graphic)
- After loading is complete, app jumps to Welcome Marquee screen and user has two options: Log In Now [X] and Log In Later [O].

title: Login Screen - Skip
custom_preconds:
- NHL.TV app is freshly installed
- User has not logged in or launched app
custom_steps:
1. From Playstation XMB or Home screen, launch app 
-Welcome Marquee displays and user has two options: Log In Now [X] and Log In Later [O].
2. Activate Log In Later [O]
custom_expected: Confirm app jumps to Step 1: Set your Favorite Team.

title: Set Your Favorite Teams - Appearance
custom_preconds:
- NHL.TV app is freshly installed 
- User has not logged in or launched app
custom_steps:
1. From Playstation XMB or Home screen, launch app 
-Welcome Marquee displays and user has two options: Log In Now [X] and Log In Later [O].
2. Activate Log In Later [O] (or login, doesn't affect the appearance)
3. When the Set Your Favorite Teams screen appears, observe
custom_expected:
- "Set Your Favorite Teams" text appears centered along the top of the screen
- A description of FAVORITE teams and FOLLOWED teams appears on the left.

title: Set Your Favorite Teams - Skip
custom_preconds:
- NHL.TV app is freshly installed 
- User has not logged in or launched app
custom_steps:
1. From Playstation XMB or Home screen, launch app 
2. On Welcome marquee, Activate Log In Later [O]
3. On Step 1: Set your Favorite Teams screen, do not select a favorite team
4. Select the "Next >" button
5. On Step 2: Hide Scores screen, select the "Done" button
custom_expected:
- Confirm app jumps to Scoreboard (Today) 
- Cycle through the Scoreboard days and confirm no favorite has been set
- Confirm no favorite are noted in Settings > Favorite/Follow Teams.

title: Set Your Favorite Teams - Choose FAVORITE and FOLLOWED
custom_preconds:
- NHL.TV app is freshly installed 
- User has not logged in or launched app
custom_steps:
1. From Playstation XMB or Home screen, launch app 
- Welcome Marquee displays and user has two options: Log In Now [X] and Log In Later [O].
2. Activate Log In Later [O] (or login, doesn't affect the appearance)
3. When the Set Your Favorite Teams screen appears, add a team to FAVORITES
4. Add a team to FOLLOWED and press next.
5. Select Done on the Step 2: Hide Scores screen.
6. After the jump to Scoreboard view, check the following locations in Expected Result:
custom_expected:
FAVORITES:

- Scoreboard: Any teams added to FAVORITE should appear first on the day schedule before any other games.
- Standings: Any teams added to FAVORITE should have a star on the tile. 
- Wildcard Standings: Any teams added to FAVORITE should have a star on the tile.
- Calendar Team Picker *** No longer indicated on team picker, need to check if that has changed

FOLLOWED:

- Scoreboard: Any teams added to FOLLOWED should appear first on the day schedule before any other games EXCEPT if your FAVORITE team is playing the same day, then the FAVORITE teams will appear before your FOLLOWED teams.

title: Hide Scores Screen - Appearance & Functionality
custom_preconds:
NHL.TV app is freshly installed
User has not logged in or launched app
custom_steps:
1. From Playstation XMB or Home screen, launch app
- Welcome Marquee displays and user has two options: Log In Now [X] and Log In Later [O].
2. Activate Log In Later [O]
3. From the Step 1: Set your Favorite Teams screen, Select Next >.
- On the Hide Scores screen, Hide Scores should be set to OFF by default.
- "Step 2: Hide Scores Setting" - " Scores can be hidden in the application to avoid spoilers" text appears centered along the top of the screen.
- There is an image of the scoreboard screen to the left with game tiles showing the scores hidden.
4. Select Done.
5. Navigate to Settings and observe Hide Scores field
6. Delete app (or data on PS4) and repeat steps, this time setting Hide Scores to ON in the Welcome Flow's Hide Scores Page
custom_expected:
Hide Scores screen appears as expected
In Settings Hide Scores is Set to Off in step 5 and On after retest and choosing On

title: Premium Account Upsell: Appearance
custom_preconds: App has been launched with live or VOD Game Tiles displayed, user is not logged in.
custom_steps:
1. Select and activate any Game Tile
2. Activate any game feed
3. At Login Required Message, observe
custom_expected:
Confirm up-sell message appears as expected including:

- Purchase link url with correct device
- Login Now/Later hints
- All text and graphics appear as expected

title: Dismiss Login Required
custom_preconds: App has been launched with live or VOD Game Tiles displayed, user is not logged in.
custom_steps:
1. Select and activate any Game Tile
2. Activate any game feed
3. At Login Required Message, Activate [CIRCLE] (Log in later)
custom_expected: Message closes to Feed Select open

title: Login to Premium NHL Account via Game Tile
custom_preconds: App has been launched with live or VOD Game Tiles displayed, user is not logged in.
custom_steps:
1. Select and activate any Game Tile
2. Activate any game feed
3. At Login Required Message, Activate [X] 
4. Observe Login Choice screen
5. At Login Choice choose NHL.TV
6. At Login, log in with Premium NHL.TV Account
custom_expected:
* Log in Choice appears as expected including a superscript ™ next to NHL.TV or Rogers in Text
* Feed selected launches and playback begins

title: NHL.TV Login via Settings - Welcome Message
custom_preconds: App is on Settings page, user is not logged in.
custom_steps:
1. Select and activate Log in
2. At Login Choice screen, choose NHL.TV
3. Login with Premium Account
4. Observe Welcome Message
custom_expected: Confirm Welcome Message Text and Graphics appear as expected including "You are successfully logged in to NHL.TV™"

title: Logged in message screen button controls
custom_preconds: App has been launched and user is not logged in.
custom_steps:
1. From Scores press triangle button to open menu
2. Select Settings > Login 
3. Select NHL/Rogers option
4. Enter valid user/pw credentials
5. When Login confirmation message displays: press each of the controller buttons EXCEPT (x)
custom_expected:
Only the Close (x) hint button will be enabled
AND the user will not be presented with any other screen 
And the user will not be returned to the sign in options or entry screens.

title: NHL.TV Login via Settings - Launch Game
custom_preconds: App is on Settings page, user is not logged in.
custom_steps:
1. Select and activate Log in
2. At Login Choice screen, choose NHL.TV
2. Login with Premium NHL.TV Account
3. Dismiss Account Activated message via [X] (OK)
4. Close Settings with [CIRCLE] (Back)
5. Nav to VOD game tile and activate.
6. Launch any feed.
custom_expected:
- User is logged in and receives confirmation
- Feed selected launches and playback begins

title: NHL.TV Login to Free Account via Game Tile
custom_preconds: App has been launched with live or VOD Game Tiles displayed, user is not logged in.
custom_steps:
1. Select and activate any Premium (non-free) Game Feed
2. At Login Required Message, Activate [X]
3. At Login Choice, choose NHL.TV
3. Login with Free NHL.TV Account
4. Dismiss Welcome message
5. Note Premium Account required Message Shown
6. Close message
7. Nav to Free Game Tile and activate
8. Activate any feed
custom_expected:
In step 5, Premium Account Required is shown
In step 9, Feed selected launches and playback begins

title: NHL.TV Unrecognized Login - expected messaging
custom_preconds: User is not logged in, app is on Settings page.
custom_steps:
1. Activate Log in button on Settings page.
2. At Login Choice, choose NHL.TV
2. Enter any text (not a valid email account!) into EMAIL and PASSWORD fields.
3. Activate [Log In] button
4. Observe Messaging
custom_expected: App shows error text "The account credentials you entered did not match our records. Please visit NHL.com/forgot to reset them"

title: Rogers Login - Terms of Service appears on first time login
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have logged out of the current build on the device
AND have deleted the old app build
AND have power-cycled the device
AND have loaded a brand new build
AND we have accessed the NHL.tv Channel
AND the channel is not linked to any account
AND the tester has a new (or never used) Rogers account
custom_steps:
WHEN the user navigates to the Settings page
AND changes the login interface to login to a MyRogers account
AND applies the credentials of their account (new or never used)
custom_expected:
THEN the Rogers NHL GameCentre LIVE Terms of Service screen will appear

NOTE: DO NOT [I REPEAT] DO NOT SELECT 'ACCEPT' TO PROCEED THROUGH THE TOS SCREEN UNTIL YOU READ THIS
Only proceed through the TOS screen if you do not have any other associated Rogers accounts to work with.
If you already have other Rogers accounts, back out of the TOS screen to preserve the account for future testing.

title: Rogers Login - Terms of Service no longer appears
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have accessed the NHL.tv Channel
AND the channel is not linked to any account
AND the user has a previously used Rogers account
AND the user has knowingly accepted the Terms of Service before
custom_steps:
WHEN the user navigates to the Settings page
AND changes the login interface to login to a MyRogers account
AND applies the credentials of their Rogers account
custom_expected: THEN the Rogers NHL GameCentre LIVE Terms of Service screen will NOT appear

title: Rogers Login via Settings - Welcome
custom_preconds: App is on Settings page, user is not logged in.
custom_steps:
1. Select and activate Log in
2. At Login Choice screen, choose Rogers
3. Login with ROGERS Account
5. Accept Terms of Use (if applicable)
4. Observe Welcome Message
custom_expected:
Confirm Welcome Message Text and Graphics appear as expected.

Welcome to MyRogers™
You are successfully logged in to Rogers NHL GameCenter LIVE™

custom_preconds: App has been launched with live or VOD Game Tiles displayed, user is not logged in.

title: Rogers Unrecognized Login - expected messaging
custom_preconds: User is not logged in, app is on Settings page.
custom_steps:
1. Activate Log in button on Settings page.
2. At Login Choice, choose Rogers
2. Enter any text (not a valid email account!) into EMAIL and PASSWORD fields.
3. Activate [Log In] button
4. Observe Messaging
custom_expected: App shows error text "The account credentials you entered did not match our records. Please visit NHL.com/forgot to reset them"

title: NHL.TV Logout
custom_preconds: User is logged in to any NHL.TV registered account and is on Settings page
custom_steps: 1. Activate Log Out button.
custom_expected:
Log Out message is seen:

You have been Logged out.
You have been successfully logged out of NHL.TV™ 

activate [X] OK returns user to Settings.
Settings Log Out button should be replaced with Log In and user ID should no longer appear beneath it.

title: Rogers Logout
custom_preconds: User is logged in to any MyRogers registered account and is on Settings page
custom_steps: 1. Activate Log Out button.
custom_expected:
Log Out message is seen:

You have been Logged out.
You have been successfully logged out of Rogers NHL GameCentre LIVE™ 

activate [X] OK returns user to Settings.
Settings Log Out button should be replaced with Log In and user ID should no longer appear beneath it.

title: Password Changed - App Launch
custom_preconds:
App is linked (logged in during previous session) to an NHL.TV premium entitled account and user has access to the associated NHL.TV account settings.
App has not been launched.
custom_steps:
1. Go to account's NHL.TV settings page and change the password.
2. Launch app.
custom_expected: Confirm user is still logged in at launch.

title: Password Changed - Video Launch
custom_preconds:
App is linked (logged in during previous session) to an NHL.TV premium entitled account and user has access to it's NHL.TV account settings.
App has been launched and user is sitting on any Day view page with VOD games that require a premium account.
custom_steps:
1. Go to account's NHL.TV settings page and change the password.
2. In app, launch any premium video stream.
custom_expected: Confirm user can still launch the video.

title: Login: Non-Latin Characters
custom_preconds: User's PS device set to Language Japanese, app launched, user not logged in to app
custom_steps:
1. Go to Settings
2. Activate Log In
3. Choose NHL or Rogers and activate
3. In Email & Password fields enter Japanese characters
4. Navigate to and activate Log In button
custom_expected: Email field does not display Japanese characters and app does not freeze at Sign In button activation

title: Scoreboard Navigation - Today Grid
custom_preconds: App is on Scoreboard view for Today
custom_steps:
1. From 1st position, top left tile, navigate to far right game tile.
2. From top right, nav [R] 
3. Continue to navigate to each tile in the grid including attempting to select beyond Game Tile grid edges.
custom_expected:
- Selecting each tile shows expected highlight/selection state.
- Game tile grid nav does not loop top to bottom or vice-versa; right to left or vice-versa. 
- [U] ARROW along top & [D] ARROW along bottom disabled.
- [L] along left edge jumps to next available tile and shifts view - if no tile available, [L] is disabled.
- [R] along right edge jumps to next available tile and shifts view - if no tile available, [R] is disabled.

title: Today's date - Transition from 12pm ET / 9am PT to TODAY
custom_preconds: App is launched in the morning prior to 12pm ET / 9am PT and on Scoreboard view
custom_steps:
1. After app launch confirm date in top right corner is yesterday's date
2. Tap [SQUARE] TODAY 
3. Wait until time is later than 12pm ET / 9am PT
4. Tap [SQUARE] TODAY 
5. Quit app
6. Launch app
custom_expected:
- Step 2: [SQUARE] TODAY has no effect
- Step 4: [SQUARE] TODAY jumps to today's date
- Step 6: App launches to Scoreboard view with today's date

title: Today's date - Transition past 4pm PT (Midnight GMT)
custom_preconds: App has launched and moved to Today in Day View, time is <4pm PT (7pm ET)
custom_steps:
1. Confirm Today's date in top right corner is correct 
2. While app is at a time preceding 4pm PT (7pm ET) observe Day View.
3. Remaining on Day view, allow app to transition to a minimum of 4:05pm PT
custom_expected: Transition past 12am GMT does not have any effect on Today view.

title: Day to Day Navigation
custom_preconds: App is in Scoreboard view, Today
custom_steps:
1. Note date in top left corner under the NHL/Rogers logo.
2. Activate L1 and note the date in top left corner after transition.
3. Repeat step 2 until 10 days back have been noted.
4. Tap [SQUARE] button & confirm return to Today's date 
5. Activate R1 and note the date in top left corner after transition.
6. Repeat step 5 until 10 days forward have been noted.
7. Tap [SQUARE] button & confirm return to Today's date
custom_expected:
Today's date in steps 1, 4 and 7 should be seen in top left. 
Each day back or forward should show the date advance as expected.

title: All-Star Game/Break (Empty Days)
custom_preconds: It's the 2016-17 Season...if not, update the All-Star dates for this test.
custom_steps:
1. From SCORES activate Select Date
2. Navigate to Jan. 2017
3. Activate Jan. 26th
4. Activate [ R1 ] to nav through to Jan. 28th
5. Repeat step 4 until Feb. 2 is reached
6. Activate [ L1 ] to nav to Feb. 1
7. Repeat step 6 until Jan. 26th is reached
custom_expected:
- Each day tested is accessible 
- Jan27 - Jan30 show "There are no games scheduled for this date" text and No Games icon
- All-Star game is not shown

title: Future Game Tiles: Activation
custom_preconds: User is logged in with a Premium Entitled account and app is launched and on Today's Scoreboard view
custom_steps:

2. Select any game tile and activate
custom_expected: App jumps to Single Game View with No Feeds Available message seen

title: Hide Scores ON - Team Calendar - Future Games
custom_preconds: Hide Scores is set to ON in Settings
custom_steps: Observe the Team Calendar: current month and a future month
custom_expected:
Confirm days in Calendar appear with only opposing team and status: 

- Time only for upcoming games

title: Menu Button Navigation
custom_preconds: User has navigated to "Main Menu"
custom_steps:
1. From Scores button, navigate right and left and up and down.
2. Repeat step one for each button.
custom_expected:
Left and right for every button is enabled and navigation loops.
Up for every button is disabled.
Down for every button should navigate into the game tile area.

title: Menu Button Activation - Scores
custom_preconds:

custom_expected: User lands on " Scoreboard" view for today

user has navigated up to "Main Menu"

user has navigated up to "Main Menu"

Defaulted Focus is on Current month and day (Today)

title: Division Standings Appearance
custom_steps:
1. From Main Menu, activate Standings
2. Activate Standings
custom_expected:
Confirm Division Standings appear as expected and match actual current standings

NHL Division Standings
http://www.nhl.com/ice/standings.htm?type=DIV#&navid=nav-stn-div

title: Wild Card Standings Appearance
custom_steps:
1. From Main Menu, activate Standings
2. Activate Standings
3. Toggle to WC view via [SQUARE]
custom_expected:
Confirm WC Standings appear as expected and match actual current standings

Wild Card Standings
http://www.nhl.com/ice/standings.htm?type=WC#&navid=nav-stn-conf

title: Division/Wild Card Toggle
custom_steps:
1. From Scoreboard view, activate [Triangle] to jump to Main Menu
2. From Main Menu navigate to Standings and activate
3. From Division Standings, activate [Square]
4. Wild Card Standings, activate [Square]
custom_expected:
Confirm app jumps to Wild Card Standings at first tap of [Square]
Confirm app jumps back to Division Standings at second tap of [Square]

title: Standings - Navigation
custom_steps:
1. From Main Menu, activate Standings
2. Toggle to WC view via [SQUARE] 
3. Activate [CIRCLE] Back
4. Open Main Menu
5. Activate Standings
custom_expected: Confirm navigation behaves as expected - Standings always opens to Division Standings

title: Calendar Grid Navigation
custom_preconds: App is on any Calendar page with the 1st selected.
custom_steps:
1. Using the direction pad or joystick navigate (up/down & right/left)
2. Navigate to all buttons along top row and for each, attempt to navigate up
3. Navigate to all buttons along bottom row and for each, attempt to navigate down
custom_expected:
- All game day tiles buttons are selectable

When navigating right from right-most tile, focus moves to left most tile in same row. 
When navigating left from left-most tile, focus moves to right most tile in the same row. 
When navigating up from top tile in a column, focus moves to bottom tile in the same column. 
When navigating down from bottom tile in a column, focus moves to top tile in the same column.

title: TODAY tag
custom_preconds: If there are no games being played in the current month, this test must be conducted in the QA environment
custom_steps:
TEST A
1. From Day View, Today, open Main Menu via [TRIANGLE]
2. Activate Calendar
3. Navigate to TODAY tagged day button and activate 

TEST B
1. From Day View, Today, open Select Date via the "Options" button
2. Navigate to TODAY tagged day button and activate
custom_expected:
TEST A
Shows favorite team calendar - if no favorite team selected, user must select a team

TEST B
TODAY is tagged for today's actual date and activation returns to Scores Day View.

title: Calendar Head
custom_preconds: Before testing, confirm allowed/expected start and end dates
custom_steps:
1. From SCORES view, Press "Select" button to show "SELECT DATE" calendar
2. Activate [L1] repeatedly to navigate to previous months until reaching earliest available month (Oct 2014)
3. Activate 1st available day in month (Oct 8 first game with feeds)
custom_expected: App able to access expected first month/day and can view 1st regular season game available

title: Calendar Tail
custom_preconds: Before testing, confirm allowed/expected start and end dates
custom_steps:
1. From SCORES view, Press "Options" on remote to activate "SELECT DATE" calendar
2. Activate [R1] repeatedly to navigate to upcoming months until reaching last available month (should be June)
3. Activate last available game day (currently April 9, 2017 so you'll need to go back a month [L1])
custom_expected:
User is able to view the last month of the season
And user can access the last game day of schedule

title: All-Star Game/Break Access (test can be marked BLOCKED until an All-Star game appears in Prod and is confirmed available in-app)
custom_preconds:
THIS CASE IS NOT VALID YET - NEED ASG INFO - BLOCK OR PASS N/A 

It's the 2016-17 Season...if not, update the All-Star dates for this test.
custom_steps:
1. From Main Menu PU activate Calendar
2. Navigate to Jan. 27th
3. Activate Jan. 27th
4. Open Main Menu Repeat steps 1-3 but in step three activate next day in Jan 28-Jan 30 have been tested
custom_expected:
- The following dates are not accessible (Jan 27th, 28th, 30th)
- User is able to access Jan. 29th All-Star game

title: Change Display Team - Favorite Set
custom_preconds:
- App has been launched 
- User has favorite set
custom_steps:
1. Open Main Menu and activate Calendar
2. Activate [SQUARE] to Change Team
3. In SELECT TEAM, choose any team (activate) EXCEPT favorite team
4. Activate Back to return to Scoreboard
5. Open Main Menu, activate Calendar and note team
7. Quit app & relaunch
8. Open Main Menu > Calendar
custom_expected:
- Confirm Team Indicator in Top Left corner appears as expected, changing when choosing different teams
- Confirm changed team persists in Calendar View
- Confirm favorite team is returned as default Calendar view after quit

title: Choose Display Team - No Favorite Set
custom_preconds:
- App has been launched 
- User does not have a favorite team set
custom_steps:
1. Open Main Menu and activate Calendar
2. Choose a team from "Select Team to View"
3. Note Team's Calendar View
4. Activate Back to return to Scoreboard
5. Open Main Menu, activate Calendar and note team
7. Quit app & relaunch
8. Open Main Menu > Calendar
custom_expected:
- Confirm Team Indicator in Top corners appear as expected
- Confirm changed team persists in Calendar View
- Confirm Calendar View resets after quit - user must choose team to view

- [CIRCLE] Back exits to Main Menu

title: Settings Navigation - Logged In
custom_preconds:
User has previously logged in
Settings has been opened from Main Menu
custom_steps: In Settings, navigate to all buttons and upon completion, activate [CIRCLE] Back
custom_expected:
- All buttons on screen can be selected/highlighted
- [CIRCLE] Back exits to Main Menu

_Note: "How to Purchase NHL.TV" button not seen when logged in_

title: Default Settings
custom_preconds: Uninstall any NHL.TV app from PS3/4, turn system off, reboot system and install current build (full test build, not patch)
custom_steps:
**NOTE:** The new flow is that when a user first launches the app, the user is specifically asked to enable or disable Hide Scores (it defaults to OFF if you skip that step) - https://jira.mlbam.com/browse/NHLPS-585 

1. Launch app and advance past Welcome screen
2. Activate "Skip" to advance past Favorite Team picker
3. Choose "Next" and leave Hide Scores at the "off" default 
4. From Scoreboard view, open Main Menu and activate Settings and observe
custom_expected:
Confirm Default Settings:

- Hide Scores Off
- Favorite / Follow Teams has nothing set

title: Locally Retained Settings
custom_preconds: Uninstall any NHL.TV app from PS3/4, turn system off, reboot system and install current build (full test build, not patch)
custom_steps:
1. Launch app and advance past Welcome screen
2. Activate a team choice and select 'Next' 
3. On 'Step 2: Hide Scores Setting' screen, select the 'Done' button
3. From Scoreboard view, navigate to and activate Settings
4. Set Hide Scores to ON
5. Remove previous favorited team and set a new favorite team
6. Quit app
5. Relaunch App & nav to Settings & Observe
custom_expected: Confirm new Settings are retained

title: Hide Scores On/Off (Button Functionality)
custom_preconds: App has been launched, Hide Scores is set to OFF
custom_steps:
(This test is only to be used to test the Settings functionality - additional and more specific tests for Hide Scores On/Off appear in the additional App tests)

1. From Scoreboard view navigate up to access Main Menu
2. Activate Settings and confirm Hide Scores is set to OFF
3. Toggle Hide Scores to ON 
4. Activate [CIRCLE] Back
5. Note Scoreboard view appearance
6. Navigate up to  Main Menu
7. Navigate to and activate "Settings"
8. Toggle Hide Scores to OFF 
9. Activate [CIRCLE] Back
10. Note Scoreboard view appearance
custom_expected: Confirm Scores/Game Data do not appear when set to ON and return when set to OFF and that the enabled states holds as expected.

custom_steps: Navigate to Today, no games yet played
custom_expected: Confirm Favorite is first tile in the grid

title: Favorites Tile Order - Today (Live games)
custom_preconds: Favorite has been chosen and is playing Today
custom_steps: Navigate to Today, games in progress
custom_expected: Confirm Favorite is first tile in the grid

custom_preconds: Tester has launched app, favorite has previously been chosen
custom_steps: Navigate to any day before Today in which the favorite team appears
custom_expected: Confirm Favorite is first tile in the grid

title: Change Favorite and Retain
custom_preconds: Tester has launched app and favorite has been set to Anaheim Ducks
custom_steps:
1. Open Main Menu and activate Settings
2. Nav to Favorite/Follow Teams & activate
3. Confirm Anaheim Ducks are favorited
4. Remove ANA and choose different team
5. Quit app
6. Relaunch
custom_expected: Favorite team chosen is retained after quit

title: Favorite Team - Team Names
custom_preconds:
Tester has launched app and no favorite has been set
User has access to team names for each team: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/NHL/Franchise+ID%2C+Team+ID%2C+Tri+Codes%2C+Venue+ID
custom_steps:
1. Open Main Menu and activate Settings > Favorite/Follow Teams
2. Favorite a team and Observe Team's name to the left of the Teams screen.
3. Select the same team and unfavorite it.
4. Choose next team in grid
5. Observe Team's name.
6. Repeat steps 3-6 until all team names have been observed
custom_expected: Confirm team names appear as expected per team (ie. Bruins, Sabers, Canadiens, etc..)

title: Launch Feed - VOD - 1st time
custom_steps:
1. Activate any archived game tile that has never been viewed before
2. Note button options 
3. Activate any video feed
custom_expected:
"Play from Beginning" is the only launch option and feed launches program from beginning.
Resume is not offered.

title: Launch Feed - VOD - Resume
custom_preconds: User has activated an archived Game Tile that contains a feed that the user has previously viewed for >30 seconds and playback position is known.
custom_steps:
1. Activate previously viewed archived game feed
2. Note button options 
3. Activate Resume option for any video feed
custom_expected: "Play from Beginning" and "Resume" options are shown with "Resume" enabled. Launch of feed resumes from position in timeline last viewed from.

title: Launch Feed - VOD - Beginning
custom_preconds: User has activated an archived Game Tile that contains a feed that the user has previously viewed for >30 seconds and playback position is known.
custom_steps:
1. Activate previously viewed archived game feed
2. Note RESUME and BEGINNING button options 
3. Activate any video feed via Start from Beginning
custom_expected: Feed launches from beginning.

Select a Multi-Cam option
custom_expected:

Video feed launches as expected

title: Full Game Playback - VOD
custom_steps:
1. Launch any archive game.
2. Let game play through to completion.
custom_expected: App should playback full game from head to tail and exit to same view user launched from without skips/stalls or buffer issues.

There is a LIVE game available and is in pregame warmups
custom_steps:

2. Let game play through to completion.
custom_expected:
- App should playback full game from head to tail and exit to same view user launched from without skips/stalls/buffer issues
- Milestones should appear as expected when game is in play
- Box score should update as expected when game is in play

title: Captions Appearance - Live
custom_preconds:
- User is logged in to a Premium Account NHL.TV
- Live games are available for playback
- Captions are set to Off
custom_steps:
1. Launch a live game from the beginning and allow to play for a minute or two
2. Tap [SQUARE] to activate Captions and observe
3. After 2+ minutes of playback, tap [SQUARE] to close captions.
custom_expected:
- Confirm captions appear as expected on first tap of [SQUARE]
- Confirm captions disappear as expected on second tap of [SQUARE]

title: Appearance
custom_preconds: User has successfully launched VOD playback with Hide Scores Off.
custom_steps: Observe UI and full appearance of all elements on screen.
custom_expected:
1. Milestones should appear in the timeline and when selected, appear as expected.
2. Linescore should appear with final result populating all fields as expected.
3. UI Hints should show EVENTS and associated SONY PS button graphics.
4. Periods and total game time should appear as expected.

title: Trickplay FWD Hide Scores Off
custom_preconds: User has successfully launched a VOD game stream with Hide Scores set to Off and playback is behaving as expected.
custom_steps:
1. Seek FWD via D-pad single tap of right button and observe.
2. Tap D-pad [R] 4x and observe.
3. Allow seek to advance >60 mins and activate [X] to jump, then observe.
4. Tap D-pad [R] 4x and let playhead advance until it stops at the tail.
5. Activate [X] to jump.
6. Let app play video out.
custom_expected:
1 - App should show ">>" indicating speed level 1, timer should advance at associated speed.
2 - Each tap of 1-3 should increase ">" and timer should advance at associated speeds. 4th tap should be disabled and have no effect.
3 - Jump should reflect expected advance in timeline and playback should resume as expected.
4-6 - App should jump to near end of stream and at play out, return Single Game launched from.

title: Trickplay FWD to RWD Hide Scores Off
custom_preconds: User has successfully launched a VOD game stream with Hide Scores Off and playback is behaving as expected. User has skipped FWD 1 Period via [R1] button.
custom_steps:
1. Seek FWD via D-pad single tap of right button.
2. Tap D-pad [L] 5x and observe.
3. Allow seek to advance >5 mins and activate [X] to jump, then observe.
4. Tap D-pad [L] 4x and let time accumulate until it stops.
5. Activate [X] to jump.
custom_expected:
2 - 1st tap should show indicator changing from ">>" to "<<" indicating speed level 1 RWD, timer should advance back at associated speed. Each tap 2-4 of [L] should increase "<" and timer should advance at associated speeds. 5th tap should be disabled and have no effect.
3 - Jump should reflect expected time jump back in game.
5 - App should jump to head of stream and play video as expected.

title: Appearance
custom_preconds: User has successfully launched VOD playback with Hide Scores Set to ON.
custom_steps: Observe UI and full appearance of all elements on screen
custom_expected:
1. Milestones should not appear in the timeline.
2. Linescore should not be present.
3. Periods should be hidden 
4. Game time should appear obscured as expected - we should not see total game time here

See https://mlb.invisionapp.com/share/NZ4AX6W34#/screens/111499032

title: Trickplay FWD Hide Scores On
custom_preconds: User has successfully launched a VOD game stream with Hide Scores set to ON and playback is behaving as expected.
custom_steps:
1. Seek FWD via D-pad single tap of right button and observe.
2. Tap D-pad [R] 4x and observe.
3. Allow seek to advance >60 mins and activate [X] to jump, then observe.
4. Tap D-pad [R] 4x and let time accumulate until it stops.
5. Activate [X] to jump.
6. Let app play video out.
custom_expected:
1 - App should show ">>" indicating speed level 1, timer should advance at associated speed.
2 - Each tap of 1-3 should increase ">" and timer should advance at associated speeds. 4th tap should be disabled and have no effect.
3 - Jump should reflect expected advance in game (TBD)
4-6 - App should jump to near end of stream and at play out, return to Single Game View.

title: Trickplay FWD to RWD Hide Scores On
custom_preconds: User has successfully launched a VOD game stream with Hide Scores On and playback is behaving as expected.
custom_steps:
1. Seek FWD 60+ Mins via several D-pad taps of right button.
2. Tap D-pad [L] 5x and observe.
3. Allow seek to advance >5 mins and activate [X] to jump, then observe.
4. Tap D-pad [L] 4x and let seek until it stops.
5. Activate [X] to jump.
custom_expected:
2 - 1st tap should show indicator changing from ">>" to "<<" indicating speed level 1 RWD, timer should advance back at associated speed. Each tap 2-4 of [L] should increase "<" and timer should advance at associated speeds. 5th tap should be disabled and have no effect.
3 - Jump should reflect expected time jump back in game.
5 - App should jump to head of stream and at play video as expected.

title: Skip Periods
custom_preconds:
User has successfully launched a VOD game stream with Hide Scores On and playback is behaving as expected
__Game has been confirmed by tester as ending with Overtime and Shootout__
custom_steps:
1. Skip FWD 1 Period via [R1] button
2. Activate [X] to jump
3. Skip FWD 1 Period via [R1] button
4. Activate [X] to jump
5. Skip FWD 1 Period via [R1] button
6. Activate [X] to jump
7. Skip FWD 1 Period via [R1] button
custom_expected:
* User can access each period, 1-3, and each jump lands as expected
* User does not see any Milestone Events 
* User does not see Overtime or Shootout indicators - Period 3 is the last accessible "Event"

title: Appearance
custom_preconds: User has successfully launched Live game with Hide Scores Off.
custom_steps: Observe UI and full appearance of all elements on screen.
custom_expected:
1. Milestones should appear in the timeline and when selected display as expected
2. Linescore should show appropriate, current data
3. UI Hints should include EVENTS text and button graphics 
4. Periods and game time should appear as expected

https://mlb.invisionapp.com/share/NZ4AX6W34#/screens/111496696

title: Trickplay FWD Hide Scores Off
custom_preconds:
- User has successfully launched a live game stream FROM BEGINNING with Show Scores set to On and playback is behaving as expected
- Game has accumulated TRT >75 mins
custom_steps:
1. Seek FWD via D-pad single tap of right button and observe.
2. Tap D-pad [R] 4x and observe.
3. Allow seek to advance >60 mins and activate [X] to jump, then observe.
4. Tap D-pad [R] 4x and let playhead advance until it stops at the tail.
5. Activate [X] to jump.
custom_expected:
1 - App should show ">>" indicating speed level 1, timer should advance at associated speed.
2 - Each tap of 1-3 should increase ">" and timer should advance at associated speeds. 4th tap should be disabled and have no effect.
3-5 - Jump should reflect expected advance in timeline and playback should resume as expected.

title: Trickplay FWD to RWD Hide Scores Off
custom_preconds: User has successfully launched a live game stream with Show Scores set to On and playback is behaving as expected. User has skipped FWD 1+ Period via [R1] button.
custom_steps:
1. Seek FWD via D-pad single tap of right button.
2. Tap D-pad [L] 5x and observe.
3. Allow seek to advance >5 mins and activate [X] to jump, then observe.
4. Tap D-pad [L] 4x and let time accumulate until it stops.
5. Activate [X] to jump.
custom_expected:
2 - 1st tap should show indicator changing from ">>" to "<<" indicating speed level 1 RWD, timer should advance back at associated speed. Each tap 2-4 of [L] should increase "<" and timer should advance at associated speeds. 5th tap should be disabled and have no effect.
3 - Jump should reflect expected time jump back in game.
5 - App should jump to head of stream and at play video as expected.

title: Appearance
custom_preconds: User has successfully launched Live playback with Hide Scores On
custom_steps: Observe UI and full appearance of all elements on screen.
custom_expected:
- Milestones should not appear in the timeline
- Linescore should not be present
- Game time should be hidden

title: Trickplay FWD Hide Scores On
custom_preconds:
- Tester has successfully launched a live game stream with Hide Scores On and playback is behaving as expected
- Tester has access to alt device to confirm actual live position
- Live feed has 20+ minutes of progress accumulated
custom_steps:
1. Seek Back/RWD 10+ mins and tap [X] to jump
2. Seek FWD via D-pad single tap of right button and observe.
3. Tap D-pad [R] 4x and observe.
4. Allow seek to advance >5 mins and activate [X] to jump, then observe.
5. Tap D-pad [R] 4x and let time accumulate until it stops.
6. Activate [X] to jump.
custom_expected:
2 - App should show ">>" indicating speed level 1, timer should advance at associated speed.
3 - Each tap of 1-3 should increase ">" and timer should advance at associated speeds. 4th tap should be disabled and have no effect.
6 - Playback should jump to Live position

title: Trickplay FWD to RWD Hide Scores On
custom_preconds: - Tester has successfully launched a live game stream as "From Beginning" with Hide Scores On and playback is behaving as expected.
custom_steps:
1. Seek FWD via D-pad single tap of right button.
2. Tap D-pad [L] 5x and observe.
3. Allow seek to advance >5 mins and activate [X] to jump, then observe.
4. Tap D-pad [L] 4x and let time accumulate until it stops.
5. Activate [X] to jump.
custom_expected:
2 - 1st tap should show indicator changing from ">>" to "<<" indicating speed level 1 RWD, timer should advance back at associated speed. Each tap 2-4 of [L] should increase "<" and timer should advance at associated speeds. 5th tap should be disabled and have no effect.
3 - Jump should reflect expected time jump back in game.
5 - App should jump to head of stream and at play video as expected.

title: Network Error (LAN pull during Video Playback)
custom_preconds: App is launched
custom_steps:
1. Open any Feed Select and launch any video
2. Pull LAN from device or wall
custom_expected:
PS3: 
User is logged out of PSN, Network Error Messaging seen in the Background
Return of LAN allows recovery - user returned to page Feed Select was opened from

PS4: 
Network Error Message seen -  "Network Error - Cannot connect to NHL.TV. Please check your network connection and try again."
Return of LAN allows recovery

title: Network Error (LAN pull during App Nav)
custom_preconds: App is launched
custom_steps: Pull LAN from wall or device
custom_expected:
PS3: 
User is logged out of PSN, Network Error Messaging seen in the Background
Return of LAN allows recovery - user returned to page Feed Select was opened from

PS4: 
Network Error Message seen - "Network Error - Cannot connect to NHL.TV. Please check your network connection and try again."
Return of LAN allows recovery

title: Network Conditioning (Playback, Errors and Recovery)
custom_preconds:
The user has connected the device wirelessly
The network is able to be conditioned by Network Link Conditioner or Charles Proxy
The initial setting for the conditioner is a normal WiFi setting (approx 40 mbps)
custom_steps:
1. Launch a video stream
2. Allow stream to play for a minute or two
3. Manipulate the settings
> Jump around to different preset profiles (eg. 3G, DSL, Edge, etc.) - if applicable
custom_expected:
Quality of video should improve/decline according to the setting
> Note: Remember that 3 mbps should be the minimum downlink for uninterrupted streaming

An error message may occur.  Possibilities include:
"Stream Error - This stream is temporarily unavailable, please try again. Both home and away feeds are available to NHL.TV subscribers."
"Network Error - Cannot connect to NHL.TV. Please check your network connection and try again."

As long as the system recovers, it is a PASS.

Recovery, in this case, means that any errors that occur are dismissible or that video/app will resume once the connection is stable.

title: Maintenance Mode (TBD)
custom_preconds: Dev has access to change config: http://lwsa.mlb.com/partner-config/config?company=sony-tri-qa&type=nhl&productYear=2016&model=PS3&firmware=default&app_version=1_3
custom_steps:
In config file, dev should enable "maintenanceMode = true" and "maintenanceModeOnly = true"
Once confirmed, dev should enable "maintenanceMode = true" and "maintenanceModeOnly = false"
custom_expected:
- Tester should observe expected (configurable) message - currently "NHL.TV is currently undergoing maintenance. Please try again later."
- When maintenanceModeOnly = true, user must quit to dismiss.
- When maintenanceModeOnly = false, user can dismiss and application loads

title: App Launch - Team Logo Failover
custom_preconds:
Application has been accessed at least once
The first initial flow has been completed already
The user is on the Scores screen

(You may or may not need to throttle the network to test)
custom_steps:
1. Select and hold the Playstation icon menu button on the remote
2. On Quick Menu, Close Application
3. Relaunch the application
4. Observe the Scores screen
custom_expected:
Any team logos that do not render upon launch are replaced with the official NHL shield.

This test is a PASS if the NHL shields are rendered on a game tile
This test is a FAIL if no logo displays what-so-ever
This test is a BLOCK if all official teams logos constantly appear (attempt 3-5 times)

title: Final Game > Highlights
custom_preconds: User has NHL.TV & Rogers free accounts (Not-paid user subscription)
custom_steps:
Log in
Navigate to a FINAL game
Select and launch any highlight

Repeat steps above with Rogers account
custom_expected:
Preroll ad plays - may need to repeat steps as the Freewheel ad server, by design, does not always return an ad - _fail if unable to see an add 10/10 tries_
User is unable to pause, engage trickplay or otherwise skip the preroll ad - user input should be disabled - *BACK [O] to back out is OK*
Highlight clip starts after preroll ad completes
